oai_dc:dc.dc:title: St. Mark United Primitive Baptist Church: history
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Fearnback, Heather; Besser, Susan; West, Carroll Van
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: St. Mark United Primitive Baptist Church
518 Maury Hill St, Spring Hill, Maury Co., TN
Church history and property survey; includes history of the building, congregation, ministers, and activities

St. Mark United Primitive Baptist Church was originially named Spring Hill Primitive Baptist. Spring Hill Primitive was part of the Big Harpeth United Primitive Baptist Association of Tennessee. On August 31, 1872, the Association convened at Spring Hill Primitive. This means the congregation dates back to between 1866 and 1872. The construction of the church is suspected to have been around 1900. It served as a local school for African-American children until Spring Hill Rosenwald School opened in 1920-21.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: African American Churches -- Tennessee; Church buildings -- Tennessee
